file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 29-30-05-05 - THERMAL SWITCH - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL THERMAL SWITCH - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do a check on the hydraulic fluid thermal switch. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY THERMAL SWITCH - OPERATIONAL ALL 29-30-05-700-801-A ♦ CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 29-30-05 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 29-30-05-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. THERMAL SWITCH - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) This procedure is applicable to the thermal switch of hydraulic systems 1 and 2. (2) The contact of the thermal switch closes at 90ÃÂ°C (194ÃÂ°F) and opens at 80ÃÂ°C (176ÃÂ°F). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-00/100 - ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE AMM TASK 29-30-05-000-801-A/400 THERMAL SWITCH - REMOVAL AMM TASK 29-30-05-400-801-A/400 THERMAL SWITCH - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193BL Hydraulic compartment of system 1 193 193CR Hydraulic compartment of system 2 D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To increase the temperature of the thermal Heat Gun -150ÃÂ°C (302ÃÂ°F) available switch Commercially Thermometer - 150ÃÂ°C (302ÃÂ°F) To measure the temperature available To permit communication between the tech- GSE 044 Headset - Ramp nicians E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Hydraulic system compartments 1 and 2 1 Helps the other technician Cockpit EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 29-30-05 Page 2 of 4 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove access panels 193BL (SYS 1) and 193CR (SYS 2) (AMM MPP 06-41-00/100). (2) Remove the thermal switches ( AMM TASK 29-30-05-000-801-A/400). (3) With thermal switches removed from the reservoirs, connect the connectors to them. (4) Put the thermometer near the thermal switch to monitor the temperature. (5) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). J. Operationally Check HYD SYS OVHT Message (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) Do the check below to make sure that the EICAS display shows the HYD SYS 1 OVHT caution message: CAUTION: • POINT THE HOT AIR JET TO THE TIP OF THE THERMAL SWITCH TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE WIRING. • IF THE EICAS DISPLAY DOES NOT SHOW THE HYD SYS 1 OVHT MESSAGE AT 110ÃÂ°C (230ÃÂ°F), STOP THE PROCEDURE AND FIND THE FAILURE. (a) Increase the temperature of the thermal switch with the heat gun until approximately 90ÃÂ°C (194ÃÂ°F). Result: 1 The EICAS display shows the HYD SYS 1 OVHT caution message. (b) Turn off the heat gun and permit the thermal switch to cool until approximately 80ÃÂ°C (176ÃÂ°F). Result: 1 The HYD SYS 1 OVHT caution message goes out of view. (2) Do step (1) for the HYD SYS 2 OVHT message. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (2) Remove the thermometer. (3) Install the thermal switches ( AMM TASK 29-30-05-400-801-A/400). (4) Install access panels 193BL (SYS 1) and 193CR (SYS 2) (AMM MPP 06-41-00/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 29-30-05 Page 3 of 4 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
